gate_name: Work on What Has Been Spoilt / Correction

18.1.hd_quote: The adherence to traditional patterns despite changing circumstances.
18.1.behavioral_axis: Builds on established patterns, preferring incremental corrections.
18.1.shadow_axis: Refuses needed updates; defers to authority even when wrong.

18.2.hd_quote: The recognition that what has been spoilt is irreversible. There is no way to correct it.
18.2.behavioral_axis: Stops throwing energy at the unfixable; redirects to solvable issues.
18.2.shadow_axis: Rages against reality; projects blame instead of accepting limits.

18.3.hd_quote: The energetic obsession to clean house.
18.3.behavioral_axis: Throws energy at correction; learns by breaking and refining.
18.3.shadow_axis: Becomes rigidly judgmental; creates as many problems as it solves.

18.4.hd_quote: Difficulties as a result of inadequacies that cannot be resolved because of inadequacies.
18.4.behavioral_axis: Identifies the one sticking point and seeks capable allies (Gate 48).
18.4.shadow_axis: Anxiety and indecision around the unfixable piece.

18.5.hd_quote: The strength to recognize a problem and to accept that it is beyond one's power to solve it alone.
18.5.behavioral_axis: Mobilizes relationships to solve systemic problems.
18.5.shadow_axis: Endless planning; avoids experiments from fear of failure.

18.6.behavioral_axis: Embodies ‘it’s already correct’ and shares methodology.
18.6.shadow_axis: Complacency; expects others to orbit their perfected stance.
